article_title: Karen Elliott House: As the Middle East Burns, the Saudis Ease Up at Home
article_text:
Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

With much of the Mideast in flames and with the U.S. unwilling to lead a fire brigade, where does that leave Saudi Arabia, America's most important Arab ally? The answer: The Al Saud royal rulers, largely powerless to affect the external conflagrations, are focusing on modest reforms to please their domestic audience, much as President Obama, though far from powerless, ducks the Mideast mess to focus on...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Karen Elliott House writes that modest social reforms have bought some domestic tranquility to Saudi Arabia, but it's hard to see how that will last.
twitter.title: As the Middle East Burns, the Saudis Ease Up at Home

image.alt: Karen Elliott House: As the Middle East Burns, the Saudis Ease Up at Home
